# Introduction {-}

This document provides a list of the commands I find myself using the most.

# Graphing

## Scales

To add tickers with percentage:

```{r, eval = FALSE}
scale_y_continuous(breaks = 0.01*seq(-1, 3.5, 0.25),
                   labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 0.05))
```

```{r, fig.height = 3, fig.width = 6, echo = FALSE, fig.align = "center", warning = FALSE}
fredr(series_id = "FYOIGDA188S") %>%
  mutate(year = date %>% substr(1, 4) %>% as.numeric,
         value = value / 100) %>%
  ggplot(data = ., mapping = aes(x = year, y = value)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(x = "Observation Date", y = "Rate") +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(legend.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = c(0.4, 0.8)) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1920, 2025, 5)) + 
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = 0.01*seq(-1, 3.5, 0.25),
                     labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 0.05)) + 
  xlab("") + ylab("Interest Payments (% of GDP)")
```
